triples.o: velocity component along the beam direction
triples.evidence: This frequency difference, called the Doppler frequency shift, allows you to calculate the velocity component along the beam direction.

triples.o: frequency reflected by the moving blood cell or boundary
triples.evidence: the frequency reflected by the moving blood cell or boundary is given by Equation 3.40.

triples.o: velocity component of motion in the direction of the beam
triples.evidence: the term v cos θ represents the velocity component of motion in the direction of the beam.
